intro: Blepharipappus platyglossus, commonly known as the broad-tongued bladderpod, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many species with small, four-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Its leaves are basal and somewhat succulent, and the flowers are arranged in racemes. The fruit is a capsule that contains several small, round seeds.
